THIRD INTERIM REPORT OF THE SELECT COMMITTEE TO ASSESS THE PRESENT CONDITION OF THE PARLIAMENTARY COMPLEX ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Gitanjana Gunawardena - Minister of Housing) , . , . . . , . . , , . , , , . , ; . , ,- ( ) (Mr. Speaker) ? ( ) (The Hon. Gitanjana Gunawardena) . . , . . -
( ) (Mr. Speaker) . ( ) (The Hon. Gitanjana Gunawardena) . . - . , . . , . , . . ICTA , . ICTA , , . . . , . , , , .
. I C T A U N D P , . 2005 , , .

Recommendations: Your Committee is of the view that Parliament being the supreme democratic institution of the State must exploit the advances of the information and communication technology to perform its functions more efficiently and effectively. Your Committee is also of the view that modern parliaments make use of these tools successfully, to facilitate Members of Parliament in their day to day functions, to facilitate the participation of the people in democratic processes and to make the parliamentary administration more efficient and effective. Accordingly, Your Committee strongly recommends that information and communication technology be introduced in Parliament at the earliest. Your Committee is of the view that ICTA set up under the Information and Communication Act of Sri Lanka is the rightful authority which is empowered by law to provide expertise, guidance and supervision to Government institutions in implementing information and communication strategies in their respective institutions. Accordingly, the Parliament has invited ICTA to be its consultant in this process and the ICTA has not only provided the above services but also has provided the funding to evolve an IT strategy for Parliament through an IT consultancy firm. The ICTA has also participated at all crucial decision making processes providing the necessary expertise to Parliament. Your Committee recommends that the partnership between the Parliament and ICTA be continued in the future as well. Your Committee having gone through the Report of the Auditor General, reports of the experts and other documentation did recommend that the balance portion of the information and communication infrastructure project be completed without any further delay. This decision was arrived at since the Financial Expert in his testimony before Your Committee was of the view that any reconsideration of the project scope at this juncture would cause a considerable loss to Parliament and the Panel of Experts have made a strong recommendation for the continuance of the project. In consideration of the recommendation of the Financial Expert, Your Committee has obtained a cost benefit analysis from Parliament which will be circulated among all the Members of Parliament for their comments and on receipt of same, the Committee will recommend, if necessary, any modifications or changes to be effected to the IT strategy of Parliament. The Committee recommends that a steering committee be properly constituted by Parliament with authority to carry forward the implementation of the ICT strategy in Parliament. This is also a recommendation of the Auditor General. Your Committee has gone through all aspects of criticisms that were levelled against this project, particularly in the media, in the aftermath of the audit by the Auditor General. The committee wishes to put on record that its thorough examination based on the Auditor Generals Report, did not reveal any evidence whatsoever to suggest that there had been any

financial or other irregularity on the part of any member of the Parliament staff of that of any other institution. Your committee also wishes to state that the project had been carried out by Parliament with the expertise and guidance of the ICTA and UNDP adhering to a high level of transparency. As recommended by the Auditor General, the Committee is also of the view that the budget for all projects be revisited again since the cost revision was effected in the year 2005 and the technology and related cost would have undergone changes over the period of time.
. . Ordered that the Report be printed.
. Petition ordered to be referred to the Committee on Public Petitions.

. . : MISS. U. D. MAHINSA PRADEEPANIE : COMPENSATION

asked the Minister of Re-settlement and Disaster Relief Services, : (a) Is he aware of the fact that Miss. U.D. Mahinsa Pradeepanie died of the bomb that exploded opposite a garment shop in Nugegoda? (b) Will he admit that (i) only Rs. 25,000/= has been given to her parents residing at No.14/1, Hill Crest Watta, Niwungama, Piliyandala, as compensation; (ii) publicity was given through media that a compensation of Rs. 100,000/= would be made to the families of the victims of the bomb explosion; (iii) however, by limiting the compensation paid by the Government to Rs. 25,000/= for a victim below 18 years of age, there is a difference between the actual payment of compensation and the publicity given to it; and (iv) the parents whose child was killed in the bomb blast are put into a difficult position as a result of this situation? (c) Will he take necessary steps to pay the compensation to those parents as publicized? (d) If not, why?

( - , ) (The Hon. Risad Badhiuthen - Minister of Resettlement and Disaster Relief Services) (a) Yes. (b) (i) Rs. 25,000 had been paid according to circular. (ii) Maximum amount payable for death is Rs. 100,000 and is paid as follows: Rs. * Amount paid to a married 100,000.00 Person * Amount paid to an unmarried 50,000.00 Person over 18 years * Amount paid to a person under 25,000.00 18 years of age (minor) In addition to above payments, a sum of Rs. 10,000 is paid for funeral expenses. (iii) Since the person died was under 18 years of age, the maximum amount payable to her in terms of the circular was Rs. 35,000 including funeral expenses and it had been paid. (iv) Rehabilitation Authority has not given publicity through any media in this connection.

(c) Since the person died was under 18 years of age, the maximum amount payable to her in terms of the circular amounting to Rs. 35,000 including funeral expenses had been paid. (d) Does not arise in view of answers given above.

Lakshman Kiriella) . . [ ] . . 40 . . ( ) (The Hon. Risad Badhiuthen) , . . . [ ] ( ) (The Hon. Rauff Hakeem) Hon. Speaker, I am on different point on the same issue. There have been instance where VIPs and VVIPs have been subjected to terrorist attacks and the Cabinet

has taken special decisions to pay compensation. But, in the Anuradhapura bomb blast where Major General Janaka Perera, Provincial councilors and others were killed, their families have become destitute. What about Dr. John Pulle? Prior to that, his house was burnt down. There is a case pending. His entire family has become virtually destitute. The Cabinet can take a decision to pay a huge compensation at least in special cases like this.
( ) (The Hon. Rauff Hakeem) During our period too, we paid compensation equality to several people. There are long lists of files.

asked the Minister of Highways and Road Development, : (a) Will he admit that (i) the construction work was started to expand and develop Kottawa-Mount Lavinia road bearing route No.255 and Piliyandala-Moratuwa road bearing route No.158; (ii) the development work has been stopped halfway for several years; and (iii) this situation is an obstruction for the flow of traffic and a cause for accidents? (b) Will he inform this House (i) the date on which the development work of the aforesaid roads was stopped halfway; (ii) the reasons for stopping work in that manner; (iii) whether steps will be taken to develop these roads again; and (iv) if so, when? (c) If not, why?

( ( . . . ) (The Hon. R. P. A. Ranaweera Pathirana) , (1) : () (i) () ; (ii) , ; (iii) ; ? () (i) , 2005, 2006 2007 ;
() , ? asked the Minister of Social Services and Social Welfare :
(a) Will he inform this House (i) whether an official residence has been provided for the Minister of Social Services and Social Welfare (Cabinet);

(ii) if so, whether it is a property owned by the State; and (iii) if it is not owned by the State, the basis on which it has been allocated? (b) Will he submit to this House separately (i) if an official residence has been allocated, whether it has been repaired or upgraded during the years 2005, 2006 and 2007; (ii) if it has been repaired, the amount of money spent in each year for that purpose; (iii) whether furniture or any other equipment for the use of the aforesaid official residence, has been purchased at Government expense during the years 2005, 2006 and 2007; and (iv) if so, the amount spent on them? (c) Will he state (i) separately, the number of units of electricity and water that have been used at this official residence during each month of the years 2005, 2006 and 2007; and (ii) the amount of money spent by the relevant Ministry for electricity and water used at the above mentioned official residence in each month of the aforesaid years? (d) If not, why?

: : MINISTERS AND DEPUTY MINISTERS : HOUSES ON RENT

() , ? asked the Prime Minister, Minister of Internal Administration and Deputy Minister of Defence, Public Security, Law and Order, : (a) Will he inform this House (i) the number of Cabinet Ministers, Non-Cabinet Ministers and Deputy Ministers who are granted the Rupees One Hundred Thousand allowance (Rs.100,000) for obtaining houses on rent basis; (ii) the names of Ministers to whom the said allowance is granted and their posts according to the order of Cabinet Minister, Non-Cabinet Minister and Deputy Minister; and (iii) the date on which the facility of obtaining houses on rent basis was granted to the Ministers for the first time? (b) Will he state the total amount of money spent from 01.06.2004 to 31.12.2007 for obtaining houses for the ministers on rent basis? (c) If not, why?

20 : 20 : TWENTY MICRONS OR LESS THICKNESS POLYTHENE:PROBIHITION 0545/08

() , ? () ? () , ? asked the Minister of Environment and Natural Resources,(1) (a) Is he aware that the production and sale for local use and the use of polythene with a thickness of 20 Microns or less have been prohibited by the order issued under Section 23 of the National Environment Act, No.47 of 1980 and published in the Gazette Extraordinary of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka bearing No.1466/5 and dated 10.10.2006? (b) Will he admit that polythene is still produced according to the old system of production and issued to the market for use? (c) Will he inform this House of the measures which have been taken so far and the measures which will be adopted in due course to enforce the laws according to the aforesaid Gazette Notification? (d) If not, why?
( ) (The Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena) . . 10.30 : . . ( . ) (The Hon. M. Joseph Michael Perera) . , ? . ( ) (Mr. Speaker) 11 .

: : NATTANDIYA DIVISIONAL SECRETARYS DIVISION : TANK RESERVATIONS 0680/08 13. ( ) ( - - ) (The Hon. Achala Jagodage on behalf of (The Hon. Samansiri Herath) (1): () (i) ; (ii) ; (iii) ; (iv) ; (v) ; (vi) , ; ? () (i) , ; (ii) ; (iii) ; (iv) ; ? () ?

asked the Minister of Irrigation and Water Management and Minister of Ports and Aviation,: (a) Will he inform this House (i) separately, the total number of tanks that belong to the categories of minor irrigations and major irrigations in the Nattandiya Divisional Secretarys Division; (ii) separately, the extent of reservations of the aforesaid tanks; (iii) the year in which the surveys have been carried out for the last time for the purpose of identifying the aforesaid reservations; (iv) whether there are occupants in the aforesaid reservations; (v) if there are occupants, whether they occupy the aforesaid reservations on any legal basis; and (vi) the relevant year, the basis and the duration of their occupation? (b) Will he submit to this House (i) separately, the names and addresses of the persons occupying the aforesaid reservations in respect of minor irrigations and major irrigations; (ii) whether alternative lands have been identified for the distribution to the aforesaid occupants of the reservations of tanks; (iii) if so, the locations of those lands; and (iv) if alternative lands have not been identified, the date on which action will be taken to grant them? (c) If not, why?
: : WANATHAWILLUWA DIVISIONAL SECRETARYS DIVISION : TANKS RESERVATIONS
( - - ) (The Hon. Achala Jagodage - on behalf of The Hon. Samansiri Herath) (1) : () (i) ; (ii) ; (iii) ; (iv) ; (v) ; (vi) , ; ? () (i) , ; (ii) ; (iii) , ; (iv) ; ? () , ?
() , ? asked the Minister of Irrigation and Water Management and Minister of Ports and Aviation, :

(a) Will he inform this House (i) separately, the total number of tanks that belong to the categories of minor irrigations and major irrigations in the Wanathawilluwa Divisional Secretarys Division; (ii) separately, the extent of reservations of the aforesaid tanks;
(iii) the year in which the surveys have been carried out for the last time for the purpose of identifying the aforesaid reservations; (iv) whether there are occupants in the aforesaid reservations;

(v) if there are occupants, whether they occupy the aforesaid reservations on any legal basis; and (vi) the relevant year, the basis and the duration of their occupation? (b) Will he submit to this House (i) separately, the names and addresses of the persons occupying the aforesaid reservations in respect of minor irrigations and major irrigations;

(ii) whether alternative lands have been identified for the distribution to the aforesaid occupants of the reservations of tanks; (iii) if so, the locations of those lands; and (iv) if alternative lands have not been identified, the date on which action will be taken to grant them? (c) If not, why?
: : ARACHCHIKATTUWA DIVISONAL SECRETARYS DIVISION : TANKS 0682/08 15. ( ) ( - - ) (The Hon. Achala Jagodage on behalf of The Hon. Samansiri Herath) , (1) : () 2000 2007 ?

() (i) ; (ii) ; (iii) ; ? () ? () ? , , : () 2000 2007 ? () (i) , (ii) , (iii) ? () ? () , ? asked the Minister of Irrigation and Water Management and Minister of Ports and Aviation, : (a) Will he submit to this House separately the number of minor irrigation tanks and major irrigation tanks which have been reconstructed during the period from the year 2000 up to the year 2007, in the Arachchikattuwa Divisional Secretarys Division? (b) Will he submit to this House (i) separately, the places that were reconstructed and the amount of money allocated for such reconstructions in respect of each of the aforesaid tanks; (ii) the names and addresses of the institutions that carried out the relevant contracts; and (iii) the names of the tanks which have been abandoned by now, due to the inability of obtaining water from those tanks for agricultural purposes? (c) Will he state whether he will take necessary steps to restore the aforesaid tanks? (d) If not, why?

Hon. Speaker, we have been following procedures. At 10.30 a.m. you stopped the question time and we went along with it. A Party Leader had given notice of our statement. I am surprised when the Minister says that he has not received notice of our statement in which case he must sort it out either with the office of the Leader of the House or the office of the Secretary-General.

( ) (The Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe) We are disgraced with what is happening here. If a Party Leader has given a statement, then he is entitled to get a reply or the Minister in charge of the subject must
ask more time. He should not get abused. You can not abuse people when they are following the Standing Orders. ( ) (Mr. Speaker) ; . [ ]

Sir, I rise to a point of Order. ( ) (Mr. Speaker) , ? ( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake)

Sir, I am raising this matter under Standing Order No. 84 (iii) as well as Article 43(1) of the Constitution. The Hon. Minister of Foreign Affairs two days ago in this House answered a Question relating to what has arisen in India over the situation in Sri Lanka and he gave an extremely good answer at that particular moment. But, today it has been highlighted that he has misled Parliament on two issues. At that time, when I very specifically asked whether the Hon. Minister of Foreign Affairs will be leaving for India, he said, "No". Then, I asked whether there will be a special foreign minister leaving for India and he said, "No" to that also. But we see a headline in today's Lankadeepa newspaper which states, I quote: " ." So, he has misled this House. We asked about some very specific information. ( ) (Mr. Speaker) , ? [ ] ( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) I would also like to say that in todays The Island newspaper - [Interruption.]

I am raising this under Standing Order No. 84(iii), which comes under Rules for Members Speaking in Parliament. You can choose whatever you want from subsections (i) to (xii). The Rules for Members Speaking in Parliament are read in line with Article 43(1) and (2) of the Constitution. The collective responsibility of the Cabinet was discharged through a Minister and the Minister so happens to be the Minister of Foreign Affairs. He responded to a Question we asked in Parliament. Also, I quote a headline from todays The Island newspaper. It states: Sri Lanka does not have an ethnic conflict, only a terrorist problem - Bogollagama So, is that why the Hon. Minister of Foreign Affairs is not being sent and a special foreign minister is going there? - [Interruption.] We do not want Parliament to be treated as a joke, Hon. Speaker. ( ) (The Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena) . [ ] . [ ] ( ) (The Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva) . ( ) (The Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena) . ( ) (Mr. Speaker) . [ ] ( ) (The Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena) . expunge . Sir, this should be expunged. [ ] ( ) (Mr. Speaker) . ? [ ]

And it being past 2.00 p.m., THE PRESIDING MEMBER adjourned Parliament without Question put.
Adjourned accordingly at 2.15 p.m. until 9.30 a.m. on Tuesday, 04th November, 2008.

(Postage Rs. 2.50) Copies can be obtained by remitting in advance an annual subscription fee to the SUPERINTENDENT, GOVERNMENT PUBLICATION BUREAU, No. 132, Maya Avenue, Kirulapone, Colombo 5. The fee should reach him on or before November 30 each year . Late application for subscriptions will not be accepted.
